summary: Brat is a coastal Kobblin-majority state on Southia in the Westford Era, year 1291. Centered on the capital Ulbligz, it straddles a river-laced littoral with 8 ports, leveraging coastal and river traffic while fielding cavalry-heavy regiments named for its burgs. Old Kobblin Shamanism guides much of public life, with rising secular and Autliardist minorities in port towns.
history: Old river-clan polities consolidated around Ulbligz, giving the city primacy in administration and ritual.
Expansion to the coast secured multiple harbors and tied inland river traffic to maritime routes.
Regiments were formalized by burg, producing the Ulbligz and Ozbiard formations that anchor defense and prestige.
Port growth at Cosxea and Drior diversified urban life, introducing secular habits and Autliardist preaching.
Border pacts with neighboring states stabilized landward trade while the fleets began organized coastal patrols.
By 1291, Brat balances cavalry traditions with port-driven commerce and cautious diplomacy on all land frontiers.
geographyNotes: Brat fronts the sea and is cut by 19 rivers, creating layered river valleys and estuaries. The state spans a mosaic of biomes (#1 predominant, with #3 and #5 inland and upland), enabling mixed settlement from coast to interior. Coastal shelves and river mouths host most ports, while inland corridors follow the major waterways toward Ozbiard and Ialsirt.
societyNotes: Demographics skew Kobblin with smaller Wildlands communities and a trace of Uruk presence. Old Kobblin Shamanism dominates rites and seasonal observances; ports show notable secular tendencies and a minority of Autliardists. Burg-named regiments project civic identity, and river shrines remain focal points for communal decision-making.
economyNotes: Eight ports knit together coastal cabotage and riverine haulage; Cosxea, Drior, and Ulbligz are key maritime gateways. Inland markets at Ozbiard and Ialsirt funnel produce and craftwork downriver. No formal route hubs exist; instead, a web of local quays and ferry-stops supports trade. Military provisioning and horse-focused logistics align with the cavalry-heavy forces, while small fleets escort merchant craft along the shore.

factions.name: Ulbligz Horse Confederates
factions.motive: Preserve cavalry primacy and keep Ulbligz central in policy and appointments.
factions.strength: Strong in court and field through the 1st and 3rd Ulbligz regiments.

factions.name: Cosxea Dock Guilds
factions.motive: Lower tariffs, expand port facilities, and secure naval escorts for merchants.
factions.strength: Strong in coastal burgs; funds minor fleet upkeep.

factions.name: River Circles of Old Kobblin Shamanism
factions.motive: Protect sacred fords and groves; regulate rites tied to seasonal river flows.
factions.strength: Moderate; high influence in rural districts and at councils.

factions.name: Autliardist Missioners
factions.motive: Win converts in ports and establish sanctioned meeting houses.
factions.strength: Minor but growing in Cosxea and Drior.

factions.name: Ozbiard Landward Militia Bloc
factions.motive: Fortify inland roads and gain budget parity with coastal priorities.
factions.strength: Moderate in the assembly; tied to the 2nd Regiment.

factions.name: Fleetmasters’ Compact
factions.motive: Standardize coastal patrols and secure funding for three small flotillas.
factions.strength: Minor; leverage increases during piracy scares.

adventureHooks.title: The Drowned Ford Oath
adventureHooks.setup: A sacred ford upriver from Ulbligz is silting in, and shamans demand state dredging.
adventureHooks.escalation: Merchants back the plan, but a Wildlands hamlet claims dredging will flood their fields; sabotage begins.
adventureHooks.reward: Ritual tokens granting favor at river shrines and docking fee waivers at Ulbligz.

adventureHooks.title: Cosxea’s Missing Convoy
adventureHooks.setup: A three-cog convoy protected by the 2nd Fleet vanishes between Cosxea and Drior.
adventureHooks.escalation: Logs show a secret stop; guild rivalries and a leak within the fleetmasters’ ranks surface.
adventureHooks.reward: Share of recovered cargo and a letter of safe-conduct at all eight ports.

adventureHooks.title: Horses of Ozbiard
adventureHooks.setup: The 2nd Regiment’s remounts fall ill on the eve of maneuvers.
adventureHooks.escalation: Evidence points to tainted fodder from a rival inland supplier linked to border smugglers.
adventureHooks.reward: Regimental favor and a permanent escort chit for overland travel.

adventureHooks.title: Shrine Stones at Low Tide
adventureHooks.setup: Ancient stones reappear on a tidal flat near Drior, drawing pilgrims and treasure-seekers.
adventureHooks.escalation: Competing claims erupt between shamans and Autliardists; a storm threatens to scatter the site.
adventureHooks.reward: Access to a guarded reliquary and rights to publish rubbings valued by scholars.

adventureHooks.title: The Ulbligz Muster Ledger
adventureHooks.setup: A payroll ledger for the 1st Regiment is forged, diverting stipends to unknown hands.
adventureHooks.escalation: Trail leads through Ialsirt brokers to a border cell seeking to hire archers from the 3rd Regiment.
adventureHooks.reward: Finder’s fee and a commission to audit other burg-ledgers, opening civic doors.
